creator: Vishnu N K
descriptionHtml:
Force close apps that are running in the background on your Android TV/ Phone / Tablet. Helps save RAM and processing power of your device.
On your TV, Use the Back Button, D Pad buttons to navigate and Center D Pad button to select.
-----Be Careful while force stopping apps as it may affect your TV adversely-----
descriptionShort: Close apps running in the background on your device.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
-Libs updated. UI tweaks. Bug Fixes.
-Added "last selection" to "select multiple" to close same set of multiple apps as you closed last time.
- Find "Open on startup" option in preferences accessible via Up Down arrow button on phones and in top bar on TVs.

More info @ https://t.me/vishnunkmr

Thanks for your continued support!

title: Background Apps and Process List: Find, close apps

creator: Vishnu N K
descriptionHtml:
Force close apps that are running in the background on your Android TV, Phone and Tablets.

Closing background apps:
✓ Saves battery, extends battery life.
✓ Helps reduce device temperature.
✓ Helps save RAM
✓ Saves processing power, i.e. reduces CPU usage of your device.
✓ Improves gaming performance of your device.
✓ Helps speed up your device.

Features:
✓ Lists User apps and System apps.
✓ Close all apps at once or Close multiple apps at once.
✓ Option to open at startup.
✓ Switch Layout as per your choice.

Supports:
✓ Android Phones.
✓ Tablets.
✓ Android TVs. (Remote Friendly)

Force stop system app(s) only if you know what you are doing; be careful as it may affect your device adversely

When you select/click on app(s) it takes you to the app info screen of selected app(s); from where you are to select "Force Stop" in order to close the app.
Closing an app implies that you are aware that all the background functionality (service, periodic task, event receiver, alarm, widget update, push message) of this app will not be functional until you/your action(s) open the app again.
descriptionShort: Close apps running in the background on your device.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
HUGE Layout Update!!!
All issues and crashes fixed.
Thanks for your continued support!
-----Upto Previous Release-----
Now close multiple apps at once using the new button provided. The app remembers the last list of apps closed by you so just hit select multiple and hit close selected apps from 2nd time on.
Fixed "Open on startup" option.
More Features will be added in future releases as per request.
--Report Bugs, Help, if required is available @ https://visnkmr.github.io/customercare.--

✓ UI tweaks, Separate UI for phones and TVs.

Thanks for your continued support!

✓ Android TVs. (Remote Friendly)

Force stop system app(s) only if you know what you are doing; be careful as it may affect your device adversely

When you select/click on app(s) it takes you to the app info screen of selected app(s); from where you are to select "Force Stop" in order to close the app.
Closing an app implies that you are aware that all the background functionality (service, periodic task, event receiver, alarm, widget update, push message) of this app will not be functional until you/your action(s) open the app again.
descriptionShort: Close apps running in the background on your device.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
✓ Bug Fixes.

✓Intro updated.
✓ Added "last selection" to "select multiple" to close same set of multiple apps as you closed last time.
✓ Separate UI for phones and TVs.

☆Tips☆
✓ Find "Open on startup" option in preferences accessible via Up Down arrow button on phones and in top bar on TVs.

More info @ https://t.me/vishnunkmr

Thanks for your continued support!

title: Background Apps and Process List: Find, close apps

creator: Vishnu N K
descriptionHtml:
Force close apps that are running in the background on your Android TV, Phone and Tablets.

Closing background apps:
✓ Saves battery, extends battery life.
✓ Helps reduce device temperature.
✓ Helps save RAM
✓ Saves processing power, i.e. reduces CPU usage of your device.
✓ Improves gaming performance of your device.
✓ Helps speed up your device.

When you select/click on app(s) it takes you to the app info screen of selected app(s); from where you are to select "Force Stop" in order to close the app.
Closing an app implies that you are aware that all the background functionality (service, periodic task, event receiver, alarm, widget update, push message) of this app will not be functional until you/your action(s) open the app again.
descriptionShort: Close apps that may be running in the background on your device.
